plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A hardy flowering plant native to North America, known for its bright yellow petals surrounding a dark brown central cone. It thrives in meadows and gardens, attracting bees and butterflies.
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susans are often used in herbal teas and have been used by Native Americans for medicinal purposes.

plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: Tall annual plants with large, radiant flower heads composed of bright yellow ray florets and a central disc that matures into seeds. These plants are widely cultivated and bloom late summer into fall.
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism; young flower heads track the sun's movement across the sky during the day.

plants.name: Fuchsia magellanica
plants.description: A deciduous shrub producing elegant, pendulous flowers usually in shades of red and purple. It blooms late summer to early fall and is native to southern South America, often grown in gardens in temperate climates.
plants.location: Southern South America, cultivated in gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Despite their delicate appearance, hardy fuchsias are surprisingly cold tolerant, surviving frosts that kill other fuchsia species.

plants.name: Erica arborea
plants.description: An evergreen shrub or small tree producing dense clusters of small bell-shaped white or pale pink flowers. Common in Mediterranean and temperate regions, its flowers bloom late summer through fall.
plants.funFact: Tree heath wood was historically used in the production of high-quality charcoal for gunpowder manufacturing.
